fields.name: Los Angeles
fields.addressAsText: 1043 Pine Ave, Long Beach, CA 90813, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

fields.addressAsText: 1840 S Central St, Visalia, CA 93277, USA
program: Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Transitional Housing Placement +

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Intensive Treatment Foster Care

Aspiranet’s Intensive Treatment Foster Care (ITFC) Program provides counseling, case management, education, and support for foster families caring for emotionally disturbed children. These specially trained families provide a stable alternative to institutional care for children who require intensive home-based support.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)

Supports families long after the adoption process has been completed, with resources, education, advocacy and crisis intervention.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Wraparound

We create an individualized program from our diverse services to meet the behavioral and emotional challengesof our families, and to develop the skills and capabilities necessary to achieve stability and self-sufficiency.

fields.name: Residential (Excell Center)-Serving All Counties
fields.addressAsText: Turlock, CA, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Excell Center 
Residential treatment program that provides at-risk boys throughout California with educational and group home services.  

Stanislaus Academy
Serves students in fifth through twelfth grades whose emotional and learning difficulties prevent them from attending traditional school.  Youth in need of special education are prepared for enrollment in a traditional public school setting.

fields.name: Santa Maria
fields.addressAsText: 204 E Enos Dr, Suite D, Santa Maria, CA 93454, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Foster Care (0-5, 6-10, 11-14, 15-19)

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Adoption (0-5, 6-10, 11-14, 15-19)

Aspiranet’s statewide adoption program is built on the belief that every child has the right to a permanent family that will provide him or her with love, security and a sense of belonging. Since 1998, Aspiranet has assisted over 1,000 adoptive families and has helped over 2,000 children transition from foster care to their own adoptive “forever families.”

fields.name: Fresno
fields.addressAsText: 1320 E Shaw Ave, Suite 140, Fresno, CA 93710, USA
program: Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Transitional Housing Placement+

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

Family Unification Program - Youth

Comprehensive case management services to youth between the ages of 18-24. Aspiranet Life Coaches will work collaboratively with county staff and community resources to assist youth in securing housing and learning how to become self-sufficient and independent.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Intensive Treatment Foster Care

Aspiranet’s Intensive Treatment Foster Care (ITFC) Program provides counseling, case management, education, and support for foster families caring for emotionally disturbed children. These specially trained families provide a stable alternative to institutional care for children who require intensive home-based support.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)

Aspiranet’s REACH Program (Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention and Hope) was developed to empower and strengthen families who have had their lives changed forever by adoption. REACH supports families long after the adoption process has been completed, with resources, education, advocacy, crisis intervention and hope.

fields.name: Stanislaus County Family and Community
fields.addressAsText: 2160 Geer Road, Turlock, CA 95382, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Turlock Family Resource Center

Services for low-income families with children five years old or younger, families at risk for child abuse or other forms of family violence, and pregnant women who need prenatal care and education.

Healthy Birth Outcomes

Prenatal education for familes in order to reduce infant mortality and low birth weight.

Pro Family

Short term family reunification program utilizing a parent partner model.

Promotora

Mental health destigmatization program utilizing volunteer Promotora.

Welfare to Work

Job readiness, vocational coaching, and English as a Second Language classes.

fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
AfterCare

Also known as Emancipated Youth Services (EYS), AfterCare assists youth who are no longer in foster care and who have not yet reached the age of 21. Includes referral and linkage services, housing assistance, bus passess, and work-related and education-related resources.

Cal Learn

Case management support for parenting youth ages 13 to 19. Provides youth with an opportunity for educational and economic success by supporting them in securing a high school diploma, GED, and job.

Transitional Housing Placement +

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Intensive Treatment Foster Care

Aspiranet’s Intensive Treatment Foster Care (ITFC) Program provides counseling, case management, education, and support for foster families caring for emotionally disturbed children. These specially trained families provide a stable alternative to institutional care for children who require intensive home-based support.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Outpatient Therapy (

Outpatient Therapy at home, school and community-based sites, including crisis intervention, individual and group therapy, case management and medication.

fields.addressAsText: 1009 J Street, Modesto, CA 95358, USA
program: Independent Living Skills Program - Youth Center
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
AfterCare

Also known as Emancipated Youth Services (EYS), AfterCare assists youth who are no longer in foster care and who have not yet reached the age of 21. Includes referral and linkage services, housing assistance, bus passess, and work-related and education-related resources.

Independent Living Skills Program - Youth Center

Drop-in Center for foser and probation youth between the ages of 15 - 21 that offers a variety of classes and workshops where youth can learn life skills as they transition from foster care, including employment training, career development, sex education, parenting, conflict resolution, and housing assistance.

Transitional Housing Placement+

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

fields.name: Stanislaus County Foster and Adoptive Families
fields.addressAsText: 151 East Canal Drive, Turlock, CA 95380, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Intensive Treatment Foster Care

Aspiranet’s Intensive Treatment Foster Care (ITFC) Program provides counseling, case management, education, and support for foster families caring for emotionally disturbed children. These specially trained families provide a stable alternative to institutional care for children who require intensive home-based support.

Emergency Shelter Bed Homes (ESBH)

Short term foster placements, limited to 30 days, where children are placed in a family setting instead of a group home until a stable relative or longer term foster care match is identified.

fields.name: Stanislaus County Behavioral Health
fields.addressAsText: 1620 Cummins Drive, Suite C, Modesto, CA 95358, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Crisis Intervention Program

Crisis intervention services for children and youth who are in the emergency room due to danger to self or others.

Crisis Stabilization Program

Crisis Stabilization services last for up to 30 days and respond within 1 hour of a referral to the local emergency room in order to complete a mental health and safety assessment of children and youth with a threat of harm to self or others.

Outpatient Therapy

Outpatient Therapy at home, school and community-based sites, including crisis intervention, individual and group therapy, case management and medication.

Pathways to Wellbeing

Pathways to Wellbeing provides intensive care coordination, and intensive home-based and mental health services to children and youth in child welfare.

School-Based Risk Assessment Program

School-based safety assessments and counseling services for students at risk of being a danger to self or others.
fields.internalNotes:
Cathy Abbott, Core Program Director
cabbott@aspiranet.org

fields.name: Merced
fields.addressAsText: 3360 N State Hwy 59, Suites G &K, Merced, CA 95348, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Transitional Housing Placement + (15-19, 20+)

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care (15-19, 20+)

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

WeCan, Therapeutic Behavioral Services, Outpatient Therapy, Crisis Stabilization (0-5, 6-10, 11-14, 15-19, 20+)

WeCan and Therapeutic Behavioral Services for children and youth at risk of high level placement such as group home, juvenile hall, or psychiatric hospitalization, including a 24/7 crisis line and a clinician mobilized to address crises. Outpatient Therapy at home, school and community-based sites, including crisis intervention, individual and group therapy, case management and medication. Crisis Stabilization services last for up to 30 days and respond within 1 hour of a referral to the local emergency room in order to complete a mental health and safety assessment of children and youth with a threat of harm to self or others.

Wraparound (0-5, 6-10, 11-14, 15-19)

We create an individualized program from our diverse services to meet the behavioral and emotional challengesof our families, and to develop the skills and capabilities necessary to achieve stability and self-sufficiency.

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Outpatient Therapy, Intensive Home-Based Services

Outpatient Therapy at home, school and community-based sites, including crisis intervention, individual and group therapy, case management and medication. Intensive Home-Based Services for parents who are at risk of or have already had their children removed by the Child Welfare System.

In-Home Therapy Program

Services for adults in the child welfare system who are court mandated to participate in therapy as part of their reunification case plan.

Therapeutic Behavioral Services

Therapeutic Behavioral Services are provided to children and youth at risk of high level placement such as group home, juvenile hall, or hospitalization. Support counselors and clinicians provide these mental health services as many hours per day and days per week as needed to address the risks and prevent higher level care.

Pathways to Wellbeing

Pathways to Wellbeing provides intensive care coordination, and intensive home-based and mental health services to children and youth in child welfare.

Collaborative Educational Supports (SELPA)

Aspiranet assists children in overcoming psychological and social challenges that are impacting their ability to succeed in school.

program: Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Foster Care

Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.

Adoption

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

Resources, Education, Advocacy, Crisis Intervention, and Hope (REACH)

Supports families long after the adoption process has been completed, with resources, education, advocacy and crisis intervention.

Therapeutic Behavioral Services

Services provided to children and youth at risk of high level placement such as group home, juvenile hall, or hospitalization. Includes a 24/7 crisis line and a primary clinician for outpatient services.

Family Focused Support Network

Intensive case management and behavioral services to assist families and children challenged by developmental disabilities.

fields.name: Salinas
fields.addressAsText: 1127 Baldwin St, Suite A, Salinas, CA 93906, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
__Foster Care__ Aspiranet secures loving homes for foster children. Whether the foster care placement lasts for a few days or a few years, we are committed to matching children with families where they will thrive.__ __Emergency Shelter Bed Homes (ESBH)__ Short term foster placements, limited to 30 days, where children are placed in a family setting instead of a group home until a stable relative or longer term foster care match is identified.

__Intensive Treatment Foster Care__

Aspiranet’s Intensive Treatment Foster Care (ITFC) Program provides counseling, case management, education, and support for foster families caring for emotionally disturbed children. These specially trained families provide a stable alternative to institutional care for children who require intensive home-based support.

__Adoption __

Aspiranet secures permanent, loving, adoptive families for youth in foster care, and provides ongoing support for adoptive families, including resources, education, crisis intervention, and advocacy.

__Therapeutic Behavioral Services, Home Alternative to Residential Treatment __

Services provided to children and youth at risk of high level placement such as group home, juvenile hall, or hospitalization. Includes a 24/7 crisis line and a primary clinician for outpatient services.

fields.name: Riverside THP+/THP+FC
fields.addressAsText: 3600 Central Ave #5, Riverside, CA 92506, USA
fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
Transitional Housing Placement+

Transitional housing support program for former foster youth who are transitioning to adulthood out of the child welfare or probation systems. Provides a safe and supportive living environment while helping youth achieve self-sufficiency and learn life skills.

Transitional Housing Placement + Foster Care

An extended foster care placement option that bridges the gap for non-minor dependents who are no longer living in a foster home, but who may not yet be ready to transition into a supervised independent living placement.

fields.programAndAgeGroupAsText:
[Fusioncharter.org](https://www.fusioncharter.org)
Serves students in grades 7-12 who are having difficulty progressing in a traditional school environment.  Provides under performing and behaviorally challenged students with a blend of direct instruction from credentialed teachers and online learning in a nontraditional independent study program.
